p: VEEV is typically spread by mosquitoes, although certain types of ticks and mites can spread the virus as well (Weaver et al. 2004). The Culex (Melanoconion) mosquito is normally responsible for the dispersal of the enzootic strain of the VEE virus (Zacks and Paessler 2010). Ochlerotatus taeniorhynchus, Psorophora confinnis, Psorophora columbiae, Ochleratus sollicitans, Mansonia titillans and Anophilis aquasalis are some of the species of mosquitoes known to carry the epizootic varieties of the VEEV (Weaver et al. 2004).
